original_solution_mapping.L1: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers
original_solution_mapping.L2: Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2982.
    Returns: the cost of each gift.
    """
    # L1
    son_teachers = 3 # Her son has 3 different teachers
    daughter_teachers = 4 # her daughter has 4
    total_teachers = son_teachers + daughter_teachers

    # L2
    total_spent = 70 # spent $70 on gifts
    cost_per_gift = total_spent / total_teachers

    # FA
    answer = cost_per_gift
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Her son has {son_teachers} teachers and her daughter has {daughter_teachers}, so together they have {son_teachers}+{daughter_teachers} = <<{son_teachers}+{daughter_teachers}={total_teachers}>>{total_teachers} teachers
Harper has already spent ${total_spent} on {total_teachers} gifts, so she spent ${total_spent}/{total_teachers} = $<<{total_spent}/{total_teachers}={cost_per_gift}>>{cost_per_gift} per gift

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=490>>490 per gift

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
